name: Ferndene Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a lovely 2 night stay at Ferndene Guest House. After reading all of the excellent reviews on here we were looking forward to our short break and from the moment we arrived at the guest house we were not disappointed. Both Christine and Richard were so friendly and nothing was to much trouble for them. We had a room on the top floor which was super clean with a lovely en suite. Within the room there was a list of local restaurants which was very helpful. One of the main highlights of this room was the wonderful views. The breakfasts were enormous and delicious and there was something on offer to suit everyone's taste. The location of the guest house is perfect and only a 2 minute walk into the centre of Keswick. I would highly recommend this guest house.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B in the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic stay we had at Ferndene!! Firstly, Richard and Christine are so genuinely friendly and helpful it was like being at home with the family. Secondly, they've also made such a fantastic effort with the guest house it has to be THE best place we have ever stayed in. The room not only had beautiful views but it was immaculately clean and fresh and just so comfortable, better than home. Breakfasts were just out of this world, very local very fresh and very generous as per a previous review we too tried to not go over board the next day due to over indulging on the first morning. Location is perfect and the free parking is always a great convenience even if a little snug. Our only complaint is that we didn't ever want to leave so can't wait to return again very soon certainly won't be staying anywhere else but here - total perfection.
reviews.title: Perfection!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B was indicated as a first class stay by others and so it proved to be. Breakfast on our first morning was so generous that we moderated our order for the second time around. The locally sourced ingredients were first class.
reviews.title: Best breakfasts in Keswick?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in their smallest annexe room which was OK for a couple of nights, and excellent value. Positioned close to the centre of the town, it was the perfect position for our short stay.
reviews.title: Super B&B run by perfect hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was available, if a bit cramped but Richard manages the situation with a smile & great charm.
reviews.title: Keswick in September/October

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually go to Keswick in our touring caravan but because of the recent weather we decided to stay B&B. I wanted something modern but not overpriced, Ferndene did not let us down! We arrived before checking in time and were able to leave our car in the car park for the afternoon and were given our room key ready for our return when our room would be made up. There were two couples in our party and the Annex rooms were lovely, very modern and well furnished, it's the small things that count. The breakfast was fantastic, we highly recommend the cooked breakfast, it sets you up for the day. Richard and Christine were very friendly and made you feel very welcome. We would definately stay at Ferndene again.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have been to Keswick many times and finally we have found the ideal place to stay - warm and friendly hosts, beautifully appointed rooms, great breakfasts, parking, good value for money and plastic taken for payment. The only thing Richard and Christine couldn't do much about was the weather, but at least they provide a good forecast so you know what you're in for. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Perfect hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much research we chose this guest house and it didn't disappoint. We arrived before the check-in time and were met in the car park by Richard who helped us with our bags. We were in Room 3 on the top floor with its great views. The room was lovely and bright with plenty of storage. Breakfast was excellent and set you up for the day. Richard and Christine are very friendly and helpful with suggestions on what to do. The location is great - very handy for the town and lake but really quiet as it's in a residential area. The off-street parking is a bonus - we didn't need to use the car at all. A great base and we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have been coming to keswick for 36 years, usually camping in the past but are now looking for a bit of luxury and comfort and we found it a few years ago at the ferndene.we come here 2 or 3 times a year and chris and mark are so welcoming, the rooms are excellent (we have room 3, the views over skiddaw are stunning!) breakfast keeps us going all day. mark is very knowledgable for all the walks and conditions of the area so you can plan a day if you are a newbie to the lakes. keswick feels like a second home to us and everything at the ferndene suits us. brilliant place to stay.
reviews.title: lovely guest house in a lovely setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Perfect location, wonderful helpful and friendly owners. A relaxing time, rooms were beautiful, not skimpy on breakfast. A lovely atmosphere. Its a must to stay at if your visiting keswick. Hopefully it will never change as it is perfect as it is.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.title: Not the best accommodation Keswick has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On tripadvisor so decided to book it. Our room was in the annexe and it wasn't the best. The double bed was almost the size of the room and there was little room for much else, including my husband and I to walk around. The bed looked like it was 2 singles pushed together. This was disguised by an old duvet underneath the sheet that we were to sleep on. There was an immediate smell of damp in the room and it felt very cold. There was only one little radiator in the room. The bathroom was smaller than an airing cupboard with a shower and a toilet. The wash basin was in the main room where we slept, so if you were getting washed or brushing teeth while someone was sleeping I could see this being annoying. There were tea and coffee facilities in the room. The cups weren't the cleanest and the kettle still had water in upon our arrival. The tea and coffee wasn't replenished. The shower wasn't cleaned daily either. As there was a water drainage problem in the shower and the water took ages to drain away, the soap scum was still visible on our so turn to the room at night. Breakfast was in the main house. It was very nice. Good ingredients and hearty portions. Overall, I was disappointed in this B and B. I have stayed at a few in Keswick and this is not the best I've stayed in. The breakfast was lovely, but at nearly £300 for just a nice breakfast and to be not looking forward to returning to our room at night isn't good enough and not good value for money. I can maybe understand the rooms in the main house charging this price, but not in the annexe.
reviews.title: Excellent all round stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Just spent a wonderful few nights with my wife at Ferndene guest House. Richard was so welcoming from the second we walking in the door and always on hand with local knowledge and recommendations. Our room (number 5) was excellent in size and comfort with all the facilities I expected after reading the other reviews. The location of Ferndene is ideal and the view from the window is beautiful. Christine's breakfasts, we both decided, were the best we had ever had and nothing seemed too much trouble. It is one of the best run guest houses i've been to and by far the best in Kewsick and we will both very much look forward to returning. Many thanks for a fabulous stay. MIchael and Lisa
reviews.title: Great location, good price, fabulous breakfast and a beautifully decorated spacious room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just came back from a short trip at the Lakes and luckily we found this guest house through Google. Christine and Richard are such good hosts looking after your every need upon arrival at breakfast and throughout the day if needed. The Ferndale is ideally located only being 2 min walk from the town centre. The rooms are spacious and decorated beautifully to a high standard. We loved it!
reviews.title: Beautiful guest house,lovely views,brill hosts,made our anniversary stay something special many thanks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely 2 night stay at ferndene.As it was our anniversary we tried to find somewhere a bit special and certainly found it at FERNDENE.We had room 5 near the top of the property but what views!The room was faultless beautifully comfy bed, walk in wardrobe,lovely sitting area to chill with a nightcap,great en-suite ,excellent complimentary brewing facilities.Richard and Christine epitomise what good hosts are to be defined as!Absolutely the best breakfast you could wish for.Nothing too much trouble very knowledgeable about the local attractions especially walks.Private parking which can be at a premium in keswick was great.The guest house is ideally situated in proximity to keswick centre no more than a leisurely 5 minute walk.We have stayed in many guest houses around the country but the FERNDENE made our celebration special!Once again thankyou Richard and Christine.
reviews.title: Great hosts, view, room, breakfast, marmalade....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, great people! We chose this guest house from the internet as the price seemed very reasonable and the rooms looked nice. we were not disappointed! What a fantastic place this turned out to be. The photos can't convey what a lovely clean, comfortable and welcoming place this was to stay. Breakfast was lovely, and we always seemed to be laughing. Christine, Richard & Caroline are very friendly and accommodating hosts. no matter what you plans are in the Lake district this is an ideal place to make the most of your time there as it added to our enjoyment and relaxation.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay!

description: Richard and Christine welcome you to Ferndene B&B Guest House - A contemporary family run guest house offering high standard, comfortable and friendly bed and breakfast accommodation in Keswick.Ferndene Guest House is quietly situated a short stroll from the centre of the beautiful market town of Keswick in the heart of the Lake District National Park We are the perfect base to enjoy the magnificent scenery whether you wish to walk, cycle and explore the huge range of outdoor activities available nearby or simply to relax in comfort and get away from it all for a relaxing or romantic break. Ferndene Guest House is a pleasant ten minute walk from the Derwentwater lakeshore with its stunning views, boating, lake steamers and the famous Theatre by the Lake.Our traditional Victorian guest house has been comprehensively refurbished while still retaining much of its original character and, with our modern Annexe conveniently located next to our car park (providing free off road parking), has been carefully decorated in a modern style throughout. Rooms in the main house offer magnificent views of the mountains, with our exclusive top floor Suite giving panoramic views over Keswick and the fells.After a restful night's sleep in one of our tastefully furnished bedrooms enjoy a relaxing start to the day with breakfast served in our comfortable dining room overlooking the garden and St. John's Church. Indulge yourself with the famous Ferndene Guest House cooked Cumbrian breakfast, selected from the best locally available and Fairtrade sources (lighter options and vegetarian breakfasts also always available on request).
